TopicTitle: What is the purpose of making bases on other planets?

Articles.Content: I just have got my first two ships in Kerbin orbit, so I guess my next step should be to land on Mun. I am just wondering, is there an actual gain that comes out of landing ships on Mun? Is there features like mining that I don't know about?

Resources are coming soon, in the mean time there's the Kethane mod..

Or just "because we can" for a reason for building off world bases.
Because it is AWESOME. Nuff' said.
You guys got any tuts on how to get into Mun orbit?

Your next step should be what you want to do, if you want to try an make a base, great. If u wanna send satellites out, great... Muck about on kerbin with jets and wheeled vehicles. Also great, do what you find enjoyable. But currently, stock has no benefit for doing anything other then u having achieved it... Afterall. A lot of people that play games would do a lot less just because the game said "this is your objectove"... This game gives you the freedom to play how u like. U can make your own objectives. Or go on the challenge forum and complete some of them.... Or you could try starting your own pen and paper career mode until the official one is implemented.... Not to mention all the additional stuff mods give u, like already stated. Kethane is a good place to start... Some awesome looking space station and base parts out there too, and I saw someone working on a mod that will let you construct your own VABS on other planets and moons.... Really the possibilities are almost endless
Once mining and resources are added, I will make refueling depots on the planets I will colonize. That way the Kerbals there will have something to do.

No real purpose.

I'd say its the same reason you put a lander and give the first walk to a kerbal in a "extrakerbinal" planet.

Thanks for all the input guys.

I don't build bases at the moment. I will when resources come in, but at the moment, bases just seem like an easier version of manned return missions: no return required.

I'd rather do a land and return mission, and if I'm feeling like a tougher challenge, I bring along a rover (but I still return to kerbin at the end).

With the coming resources, or the Kethane mod, you could build a base that works as a centre of operations for exploring a moon or planet.

Wether this is more practical than a station depends on the circumstances. An orbiting station can more easy reach many different places, using landers, but this requires your landers to be capable of reaching orbit at a single stage.

A plane, rover, or sub-orbital vehicle from a base does not need to reach orbit, but must travel all the way to its destination on its own.

Apart from that, it can be pretty fun starting a little establishment on another body.

Or just "because we can" for a reason for building off world bases.

In people with powerful computers and massive ground bases, it's more like "Hey! My rig can do this! How about yours?"
How else am I going to take over the universe? Gotta fund the trip to the Sol System somehow!
Because there awesome.
Someone once asked why climb mount Everest? Because is is there. Well space is there. And we are going to climb it.
KSP isn't a game about 'why'. It's a game about 'why not?'.
